result.execSummary:
The defendant Victor Eugene Gray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Hearing 1/16/2015.***Court hearing: order SETTING RESTITUTION AT ZERO. Judge Stephanie Rothstein***.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS/CASE:  Court costs, fees, surcharges, DNA surcharge, and restitution.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count two, and consecutive to 06CF4969.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with the victims family Lauranette L., Lanette M., Billy B., Lanisha M. or any witnesses that testified at the trial.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample unless previously submitted, pay surcharge.
Pursuant to Wisconsin statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restirctions: firearm possession, voting.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one,  and consecutive to 06CF4969.

Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
JUDGE KONKOL FOR JUDGE ROTHSTEIN. At the hour of 10:45 a.m. the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY as to COUNTS 1 & 2 which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgments of conviction. Exhibit list received and filed. 

Court ordered a presentence investigation WITHOUT a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. 
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  
Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in custody.  Grant Huebner on behalf of Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
JUDGE KONKOL FOR JUDGE ROTHSTEIN. Trial continued. Jury deliberations began at 9:10 a.m. Jury question received and filed. Judge Konkol for Judge Rothstein. Discussion regarding jury question. Court sent back note requesting clarification of the jury question. Jury deliberations continued.

Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Trial continued. Jury in the box: 1:39 p.m. Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:37 p.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Terrell & Scharew who were duly sworn for that purpose. Jury questions received at 3:09 p.m. Court addressed questions with both parties. Jury in the box: 3:41 p.m. Jury viewed exhibit 100. Jury out of the box: 3:53 p.m. Continued deliberations. Jury questions received at 4:20 p.m. Total of five (5) jury questions received and filed. Court reviewed questions with both parties. Continued deliberations. Jury in the box: 4:52 p.m. Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 4:55 p.m. Case adjourned to 10/13/14 at 9:00 a.m. for continued deliberations in Branch 25.  Jury trial scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Trial continued. Jury in the box: 8:49 a.m. Sworn for the defense: Victor Gray. Exhibits 97-102 received. Jury out of the box: 10:36 a.m. Sidebars placed on the record. Discussion regarding jury instructions. Case passed to address court calendar. Case recalled. Appearances remain the same. Court made rulings as to State's rebuttal witness testimony. Jury in the box: 11:35 a.m. Defense rests. Sworn for the State on rebuttal: Milwaukee Police Detective James Hensley. State rests. Testimony closed. Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 12:03 p.m. Court admonished the gallery for courtroom behavior. Sidebar placed on the record. State made request for lesser-included offense of Second Degree Reckless Homicide. Court denied State's request for reasons stated on the record. Case adjourned to 1:30 p.m. for continuation of jury trial in Branch 25.

Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Trial continued. Jury in the box: Sworn for the Defense: Milwaukee Police Officer Daniel Keller, Milwaukee Police Detectives Rodney Young, Luke O-Day, Mark Peterson. Exhibits 97-100 received. Court instruced jury. Jury out of the box: 3:52 p.m. Court held colloquy with the defendant. Court finds the defendant knowingly, freely and voluntarily elects to testify. Case adjourned to 10/10/2014 at 8:30 a.m. for continuation of jury trial in Branch 25.

Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Trial continued. Discussion regarding State's witnesses. Jury in the box: 9:35 a.m. Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Detective Jeremiah Jacks, Firearm and Toolmark Examiner Mark Simonson, Milwaukee Police Detective Mark Peterson. Exhibits 64, 74,76 & 94-96 received. State rests. Jury out of the box: 11:01 a.m. Sidebar placed on the record. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied by the Court. In chambers discussion placed on the record. Discussion regarding defense witness. Witness Shawntell W. refuses to leave the court staging area. Court ordered testimony be taken. Sworn in: Milwaukee Sheriff's Deputy Joy Suszek. Testimony concluded. Further discussion of witness. Defense requests the Court declare the witness unavailable. State does not object. Court grants defense request and will allow the witness's statement to be used. Case adjourned to 1:30 p.m. for continuation of jury trial in Branch 25.
Court ordered body attachment cancelled for Jazomon J.

Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Trial continued. Jury in the box: 1:31 p.m. Sworn for the State: Jasmine O., Victoria W., Jazomon J. Jury out of the box: 3:21 p.m. Court vacated warrant for witness Jazomon J. Cancellation warrant signed and filed. Copy given to Sheriff's Department. Discussion regarding photos State intends to introduce into evidence. Jury in the box: 3:47 p.m. Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Forensic Investigators Alan Winter and Jennifer Kujawa, Milwaukee Police Detectives Dennis DeValkenaere, Daniel Knitter and Timothy Graham. Exhibits 54-59, 86-90, 92 received. Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 4:53 p.m. Sidebars placed on the record. Case adjourned to 10/09/14 at 9:00 a.m. for continuation of jury trial in Branch 25.

Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Trial continued. Jury in the box: 9:50 a.m. Sworn for the State: Deputy Chief Medical Examiner Wieslawa Tlomak, Milwaukee Police Detective Charles Mueller. Exhibits 73 & 91 received. Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 10:38 a.m. Sidebar from yesterday placed on the record. Jury in the box: 11:03 a.m. Sworn for the State: Demenge B. Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 11:58 a.m. Case adjourned to 1:15 p.m. for continuation of jury trial in Branch 25.

Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. Defaulting witness Jazomon J. in court. Court ordered testimony be taken. Witness Jazomon J. sworn in. Testimony completed. Court admonished witness for not complying with the subpoena. Court ordered witness to remain in the courtroom for the remainder of the day today and arrive at court tomorrow morning at 8:30 a.m. Jury in the box: 1:42 p.m. Jury sworn. Jury list received and filed. Court instructed jury. Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded. Exhibit 77 received and the Court read the stipulation to the jury. Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Daniel Sutyak, Milwaukee Police Detective Michael Walisiewicz. Jury out of the box: 2:52 p.m. Jury in the box: 3:19 p.m. Continued testimony of Detective Michael Walisiewicz. Sworn for the State: DNA Analyst Sharon Polakowski, Peter B. Exhibits 1-20, 22-53, 65-67, 72, 75 & 78-85 received. Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 4:53 p.m. Case adjourned to 9:15 a.m. for continuation of jury trial in Branch 25.

Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. Discussion regarding jury instructions and stipulations. Court accepted both stipulations. Discussion regarding defaulting witness. Court took a brief break to allow defendant to speak with counsel reqarding request for adjournment. Defense counsel requested adjournment due to essential witness not appearing in court. Affidavit of Personal Service for defaulting witness Jazomom J. submitted by attorney Earle received and filed. On agreement of both parties, Court ordered this matter adjourned to allow parties to attempt to locate the defaulting witness. Court issued a body attachment. Case adjourned to 1:30 p.m. for jury trial in Branch 25.
Witness failing to appear, Court ordered a Body Attachment to be issued for defaulting witness Jazomon J. Milwaukee Police Detective Timothy Graham given warrant to bring to the Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. Parties are prepared to proceed. Discussion regarding discovery issues previously brought up at the last court date. State placed offer on the record. Court held colloquy with the defendant. Defendant rejected the State's offer on the record. Discussion regarding State's motions in limine and witnesses who have not been located yet. Court held sidebar with both parties. Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:43 p.m.  Jury panel out of the box: 3:59 p.m. Jury panel in the box: 4:18 p.m. Continued voir dire. In chambers discussion with both parties. Parties back in court. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled. Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 4:53 p.m. Court ordered witness sequestration. Sidebars placed on the record. Discussion regarding strikes for cause.  Case adjourned to 10:00 a.m. for jury trial in Branch 25.
Order to produce witness Atoary Harrington to Branch 25 on 10/06/14 signed and filed. Copies given to Sheriff's Department. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Order to produce witness Shawtell D. Wiley to Branch 25 on 10/06/14 signed and filed. Copies given to Sheriff's Department. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Case heard as to defense motion for additional discovery.  The "M" files requested are not available as they pertain to open cases.  Court instructed the state to conduct a personal review of the files and statements made by the witnessess.  State is to advise the court as to the findings and a decision to release information to defense will be made by the court.  Case is adjourned to date of trial.
Attorney Earle requests this matter be set for a hearing prior to the jury trial date. State notified. Case adjourned to 9/30/14 at 1:30 p.m. for Hearing in Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Compel Discovery received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Attorney Earle in court to file Defendant's Demand for Speedy Trial. Jury trial currently scheduled for 10/06/2014 is within the time frame Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in court with attorney Patrick T Earle.  Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in custody.  Antoni J Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. State filed a motion requesting an adjournment of the jury trial date due to essential witness unavailability. Defense counsel does not object. Parties are not requesting an additional final pretrial, all pretrial issues have been resolved. State placed offer on the record. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Jury trial scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn Jury Trial received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defendant's List of Witnesses received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Patrick T Earle in court, defendant Victor Eugene Gray not in court, in custody.  Antoni J Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Branch 25 is in trial and unable to hear this matter. Parties are prepared to proceed to trial. Per court, this matter will be set for an adjourned final pretrial. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 7/14/2014. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's 2nd Amended Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
AMENDED Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Notice of State's Intent to Use DNA Evidence received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Petition and Order for Funeral Pass, denied. Order signed and filed and copy forwarded to Atty Earl.  cf
for Funeral Pass received and forwarded to Judge Dugan for review, as pair for Judge Rothstein.  /cf

Attorney Patrick T. Earle in court, defendant Victor Eugene Gray not in court, in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for status conference. Defense counsel is waiting on additional discovery and has received an offer from the State. Defense counsel to file motions by 04/10/2014. Court ordered parties be prepared to litigate any motions filed on the final pretrial date. Court ordered parties to file witness lists, jury instructions with proposed substantive instructions and motions in limine by final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 09:00 am.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions, received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.

Attorney Patrick T. Earle in court.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel is newly appointed and asked for additional time.  Status conference scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in court with attorney Bridget Krause.  Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in custody.  Antoni J Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to withdraw as counsel, argued and granted.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in Br 25.  Status conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Attorney Bridget Krause in court, defendant Victor Eugene Gray not in court, in custody.  Antoni J Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Krause was unavailable today due to a personal circumstance.  Case adjourned motion to withdraw.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel received and filed.
Original Transcript (17 pages) commenced on 02-07-2014 PRELIMINARY HEARING / ARRAIGNMENT received and filed.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #06CF4969 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Mark Peterson-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in court with attorney Bridget Krause.  Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in custody.  Antoni J Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State files an AMENDED CRIMINAL COMPLAINT ADDING COUNT 2:POSSESSION OF A FIREARM BY A FELON, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.29(2), 939.50(3)(g) a Class G Felony.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Demenge B.

Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Victor Eugene Gray in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
